Description: Sherd of Attic black-figured pottery stand, perhaps from dinos; heavy round moulding at exterior, glazed, with red band at top of moulding; interior extends further down before the break. Above, animal frieze consisting of bull to left (back, shoulders, forelegs and head missing; added red on haunch, back, underbelly), and at right, siren or bird (back, belly and head missing; red on wing and tail feathers) to right. Inside glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "22" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other AM1371 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2178)
